DORZOLAMIDE

  • Indications and doses
  • Pregnancy
  • Hepatic impairment
  • Renal impairment
  • Contra indications
  • Side effects
  • Cautions
  • Prescribing and dispensing
  • Allergy and cross sensitivity
  • Medicinal forms

Indications and doses

Raised intra-ocular pressure in ocular hypertension used alone in patients unresponsive to beta-blockers or if beta-blockers contra-indicated, Open-angle glaucoma used alone in patients unresponsive to beta-blockers or if beta-blockers contra-indicated, Pseudo-exfoliative glaucoma used alone in patients unresponsive to beta-blockers or if beta-blockers contra-indicated,

To the eye

  • For adults
    Apply 3 times a day.

Raised intra-ocular pressure in ocular hypertension as adjunct to beta-blocker, Open-angle glaucoma as adjunct to beta-blocker, Pseudo-exfoliative glaucoma as adjunct to beta-blocker,

To the eye

  • For adults
    Apply twice daily.

Advice when patient is pregnant

Manufacturer advises avoid—toxicity in animal studies.

Advice regarding hepatic impairment

Manufacturer advises caution— no information available.

Advice regarding renal impairment

Avoid if eGFR less than 30 mL/ minute/1.73 m2.

Contra indications

  • Hyperchloraemic acidosis

Known side effects

General side effects

commonOrVeryCommon: Asthenia, bitter taste, blurred vision, conjunctivitis, eyelid inflammation, headache, lacrimation, nausea, ocular irritation, superficial punctate keratitis,

uncommon: Iridocyclitis,

rare: Contact dermatitis, corneal oedema, dizziness, dry mouth, epistaxis, eyelid crusting, paraesthesia, Stevens-Johnson syndrome, throat irritation, toxic epidermal necrolysis, transient myopia, urolithiasis,

Systemic absorption can rarely cause sulfonamide-like side-effects and may require discontinuation if severe.

Cautions regarding administration

  • Chronic corneal defects
  • history of intra-ocular surgery
  • history of renal calculi
  • low endothelial cell count
  • systemic absorption follows topical application

Information regarding prescribing and dispensing

Although multi-dose dorzolamide eye drops commonly contain preservatives, preservative-free unit dose vials may be available.

Advice regarding allergies and cross sensitivities

Contraindicated if history of sulfonamide hypersensitivity.

Prepared medicinal forms of DORZOLAMIDE

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.

Eye drops
